00026 typedef enum _ASINetworkErrorType {
00027     ASIConnectionFailureErrorType = 1,
00028     ASIRequestTimedOutErrorType = 2,
00029     ASIAuthenticationErrorType = 3,
00030     ASIRequestCancelledErrorType = 4,
00031     ASIUnableToCreateRequestErrorType = 5,
00032     ASIInternalErrorWhileBuildingRequestType  = 6,
00033     ASIInternalErrorWhileApplyingCredentialsType  = 7,
00034         ASIFileManagementError = 8,
00035         ASITooMuchRedirectionErrorType = 9,
00036         ASIUnhandledExceptionError = 10
00037         
00038 } ASINetworkErrorType;
00039 
00040 // The error domain that all errors generated by ASIHTTPRequest use
00041 extern NSString* const NetworkRequestErrorDomain;
00042 
00043 // You can use this number to throttle upload and download bandwidth in iPhone OS apps send or receive a large amount of data
00044 // This may help apps that might otherwise be rejected for inclusion into the app store for using excessive bandwidth
00045 // This number is not official, as far as I know there is no officially documented bandwidth limit
00046 extern unsigned long const ASIWWANBandwidthThrottleAmount;
00047 
00048 @interface ASIHTTPRequest : NSOperation {
00049         
00050         // The url for this operation, should include GET params in the query string where appropriate
00051         NSURL *url; 
00052         
00053         // The delegate, you need to manage setting and talking to your delegate in your subclasses
00054         id delegate;
00055         
00056         // A queue delegate that should *ALSO* be notified of delegate message (used by ASINetworkQueue)
00057         id queue;
00058         
00059         // HTTP method to use (GET / POST / PUT / DELETE / HEAD). Defaults to GET
00060         NSString *requestMethod;
00061         
00062         // Request body - only used when the whole body is stored in memory (shouldStreamPostDataFromDisk is false)
00063         NSMutableData *postBody;
00064         
00065         // gzipped request body used when shouldCompressRequestBody is YES
00066         NSData *compressedPostBody;
00067         
00068         // When true, post body will be streamed from a file on disk, rather than loaded into memory at once (useful for large uploads)
00069         // Automatically set to true in ASIFormDataRequests when using setFile:forKey:
00070         BOOL shouldStreamPostDataFromDisk;
00071         
00072         // Path to file used to store post body (when shouldStreamPostDataFromDisk is true)
00073         // You can set this yourself - useful if you want to PUT a file from local disk 
00074         NSString *postBodyFilePath;
00075         
00076         // Path to a temporary file used to store a deflated post body (when shouldCompressPostBody is YES)
00077         NSString *compressedPostBodyFilePath;
00078         
00079         // Set to true when ASIHTTPRequest automatically created a temporary file containing the request body (when true, the file at postBodyFilePath will be deleted at the end of the request)
00080         BOOL didCreateTemporaryPostDataFile;
00081         
00082         // Used when writing to the post body when shouldStreamPostDataFromDisk is true (via appendPostData: or appendPostDataFromFile:)
00083         NSOutputStream *postBodyWriteStream;
00084         
00085         // Used for reading from the post body when sending the request
00086         NSInputStream *postBodyReadStream;
00087         
00088         // Dictionary for custom HTTP request headers
00089         NSMutableDictionary *requestHeaders;
00090         
00091         // Set to YES when the request header dictionary has been populated, used to prevent this happening more than once
00092         BOOL haveBuiltRequestHeaders;
00093         
00094         // Will be populated with HTTP response headers from the server
00095         NSDictionary *responseHeaders;
00096         
00097         // Can be used to manually insert cookie headers to a request, but it's more likely that sessionCookies will do this for you
00098         NSMutableArray *requestCookies;
00099         
00100         // Will be populated with cookies
00101         NSArray *responseCookies;
00102         
00103         // If use useCookiePersistance is true, network requests will present valid cookies from previous requests
00104         BOOL useCookiePersistance;
00105         
00106         // If useKeychainPersistance is true, network requests will attempt to read credentials from the keychain, and will save them in the keychain when they are successfully presented
00107         BOOL useKeychainPersistance;
00108         
00109         // If useSessionPersistance is true, network requests will save credentials and reuse for the duration of the session (until clearSession is called)
00110         BOOL useSessionPersistance;
00111         
00112         // If allowCompressedResponse is true, requests will inform the server they can accept compressed data, and will automatically decompress gzipped responses. Default is true.
00113         BOOL allowCompressedResponse;
00114         
00115         // If shouldCompressRequestBody is true, the request body will be gzipped. Default is false.
00116         // You will probably need to enable this feature on your webserver to make this work. Tested with apache only.
00117         BOOL shouldCompressRequestBody;
00118         
00119         // When downloadDestinationPath is set, the result of this request will be downloaded to the file at this location
00120         // If downloadDestinationPath is not set, download data will be stored in memory
00121         NSString *downloadDestinationPath;
00122         
00123         //The location that files will be downloaded to. Once a download is complete, files will be decompressed (if necessary) and moved to downloadDestinationPath
00124         NSString *temporaryFileDownloadPath;
00125         
00126         // Used for writing data to a file when downloadDestinationPath is set
00127         NSOutputStream *fileDownloadOutputStream;
00128         
00129         // When the request fails or completes successfully, complete will be true
00130         BOOL complete;
00131         
00132         // If an error occurs, error will contain an NSError
00133         // If error code is = ASIConnectionFailureErrorType (1, Connection failure occurred) - inspect [[error userInfo] objectForKey:NSUnderlyingErrorKey] for more information
00134         NSError *error;
00135         
00136         // Username and password used for authentication
00137         NSString *username;
00138         NSString *password;
00139         
00140         // Domain used for NTLM authentication
00141         NSString *domain;
00142         
00143         // Username and password used for proxy authentication
00144         NSString *proxyUsername;
00145         NSString *proxyPassword;
00146         
00147         // Domain used for NTLM proxy authentication
00148         NSString *proxyDomain;
00149         
00150         // Delegate for displaying upload progress (usually an NSProgressIndicator, but you can supply a different object and handle this yourself)
00151         id uploadProgressDelegate;
00152         
00153         // Delegate for displaying download progress (usually an NSProgressIndicator, but you can supply a different object and handle this yourself)
00154         id downloadProgressDelegate;
00155         
00156         // Whether we've seen the headers of the response yet
00157     BOOL haveExaminedHeaders;
00158         
00159         // Data we receive will be stored here. Data may be compressed unless allowCompressedResponse is false - you should use [request responseData] instead in most cases
00160         NSMutableData *rawResponseData;
00161         
00162         // Used for sending and receiving data
00163     CFHTTPMessageRef request;   
00164         CFReadStreamRef readStream;
00165         
00166         // Used for authentication
00167     CFHTTPAuthenticationRef requestAuthentication; 
00168         NSMutableDictionary *requestCredentials;
00169         
00170         // Used during NTLM authentication
00171         int authenticationRetryCount;
00172         
00173         // Authentication scheme (Basic, Digest, NTLM)
00174         NSString *authenticationScheme;
00175         
00176         // Realm for authentication when credentials are required
00177         NSString *authenticationRealm;
00178         
00179         // And now, the same thing, but for authenticating proxies
00180         BOOL needsProxyAuthentication;
00181         
00182         // When YES, ASIHTTPRequest will present a dialog allowing users to enter credentials when no-matching credentials were found for a server that requires authentication
00183         // The dialog will not be shown if your delegate responds to authenticationNeededForRequest:
00184         // Default is NO.
00185         BOOL shouldPresentAuthenticationDialog;
00186         
00187         // When YES, ASIHTTPRequest will present a dialog allowing users to enter credentials when no-matching credentials were found for a proxy server that requires authentication
00188         // The dialog will not be shown if your delegate responds to proxyAuthenticationNeededForRequest:
00189         // Default is YES (basically, because most people won't want the hassle of adding support for authenticating proxies to their apps)
00190         BOOL shouldPresentProxyAuthenticationDialog;    
00191         
00192         // Used for proxy authentication
00193     CFHTTPAuthenticationRef proxyAuthentication; 
00194         NSMutableDictionary *proxyCredentials;
00195         
00196         // Used during authentication with an NTLM proxy
00197         int proxyAuthenticationRetryCount;
00198         
00199         // Authentication scheme for the proxy (Basic, Digest, NTLM)
00200         NSString *proxyAuthenticationScheme;    
00201         
00202         // Realm for proxy authentication when credentials are required
00203         NSString *proxyAuthenticationRealm;
00204         
00205         // HTTP status code, eg: 200 = OK, 404 = Not found etc
00206         int responseStatusCode;
00207         
00208         NSString *responseStatusMessage;
00209         
00210         // Size of the response
00211         unsigned long long contentLength;
00212         
00213         // Size of the partially downloaded content
00214         unsigned long long partialDownloadSize;
00215         
00216         // Size of the POST payload
00217         unsigned long long postLength;  
00218         
00219         // The total amount of downloaded data
00220         unsigned long long totalBytesRead;
00221         
00222         // The total amount of uploaded data
00223         unsigned long long totalBytesSent;
00224         
00225         // Last amount of data read (used for incrementing progress)
00226         unsigned long long lastBytesRead;
00227         
00228         // Last amount of data sent (used for incrementing progress)
00229         unsigned long long lastBytesSent;
00230         
00231         // This lock will block the request until the delegate supplies authentication info
00232         NSConditionLock *authenticationLock;
00233         
00234         // This lock prevents the operation from being cancelled at an inopportune moment
00235         NSRecursiveLock *cancelledLock;
00236         
00237         // Called on the delegate when the request completes successfully
00238         SEL didFinishSelector;
00239         
00240         // Called on the delegate when the request fails
00241         SEL didFailSelector;
00242         
00243         // Used for recording when something last happened during the request, we will compare this value with the current date to time out requests when appropriate
00244         NSDate *lastActivityTime;
00245         
00246         // Number of seconds to wait before timing out - default is 10
00247         NSTimeInterval timeOutSeconds;
00248         
00249         // Will be YES when a HEAD request will handle the content-length before this request starts
00250         BOOL shouldResetProgressIndicators;
00251         
00252         // Used by HEAD requests when showAccurateProgress is YES to preset the content-length for this request
00253         ASIHTTPRequest *mainRequest;
00254         
00255         // When NO, this request will only update the progress indicator when it completes
00256         // When YES, this request will update the progress indicator according to how much data it has received so far
00257         // The default for requests is YES
00258         // Also see the comments in ASINetworkQueue.h
00259         BOOL showAccurateProgress;
00260         
00261         // Used to ensure the progress indicator is only incremented once when showAccurateProgress = NO
00262         BOOL updatedProgress;
00263         
00264         // Prevents the body of the post being built more than once (largely for subclasses)
00265         BOOL haveBuiltPostBody;
00266         
00267         // Used internally, may reflect the size of the internal buffer used by CFNetwork
00268         // POST / PUT operations with body sizes greater than uploadBufferSize will not timeout unless more than uploadBufferSize bytes have been sent
00269         // Likely to be 32KB on iPhone 3.0, 128KB on Mac OS X Leopard and iPhone 2.2.x
00270         unsigned long long uploadBufferSize;
00271         
00272         // Text encoding for responses that do not send a Content-Type with a charset value. Defaults to NSISOLatin1StringEncoding
00273         NSStringEncoding defaultResponseEncoding;
00274         
00275         // The text encoding of the response, will be defaultResponseEncoding if the server didn't specify. Can't be set.
00276         NSStringEncoding responseEncoding;
00277         
00278         // Tells ASIHTTPRequest not to delete partial downloads, and allows it to use an existing file to resume a download. Defaults to NO.
00279         BOOL allowResumeForFileDownloads;
00280         
00281         // Custom user information associated with the request
00282         NSDictionary *userInfo;
00283         
00284         // Use HTTP 1.0 rather than 1.1 (defaults to false)
00285         BOOL useHTTPVersionOne;
00286         
00287         // When YES, requests will automatically redirect when they get a HTTP 30x header (defaults to YES)
00288         BOOL shouldRedirect;
00289         
00290         // Used internally to tell the main loop we need to stop and retry with a new url
00291         BOOL needsRedirect;
00292         
00293         // Incremented every time this request redirects. When it reaches 5, we give up
00294         int redirectCount;
00295         
00296         // When NO, requests will not check the secure certificate is valid (use for self-signed cerficates during development, DO NOT USE IN PRODUCTION) Default is YES
00297         BOOL validatesSecureCertificate;
00298         
00299         // Details on the proxy to use - you could set these yourself, but it's probably best to let ASIHTTPRequest detect the system proxy settings
00300         NSString *proxyHost;
00301         int proxyPort;
00302         
00303         // URL for a PAC (Proxy Auto Configuration) file. If you want to set this yourself, it's probably best if you use a local file
00304         NSURL *PACurl;
00305         
00306         // True when request is attempting to handle an authentication challenge
00307         BOOL authenticationChallengeInProgress;
00308         
00309         // When YES, ASIHTTPRequests will present credentials from the session store for requests to the same server before being asked for them
00310         // This avoids an extra round trip for requests after authentication has succeeded, which is much for efficient for authenticated requests with large bodies, or on slower connections
00311         // Set to NO to only present credentials when explictly asked for them
00312         // This only affects credentials stored in the session cache when useSessionPersistance is YES. Credentials from the keychain are never presented unless the server asks for them
00313         // Default is YES
00314         BOOL shouldPresentCredentialsBeforeChallenge;
00315 }

00320 - (id)initWithURL:(NSURL *)newURL;

00327 // Add a custom header to the request
00328 - (void)addRequestHeader:(NSString *)header value:(NSString *)value;
00329 
00330 // Populate the request headers dictionary. Called before a request is started, or by a HEAD request that needs to borrow them
00331 - (void)buildRequestHeaders;
00332 
00333 // Used to apply authorization header to a request before it is sent (when shouldPresentCredentialsBeforeChallenge is YES)
00334 - (void)applyAuthorizationHeader;
00335 
00336 // Create the post body
00337 - (void)buildPostBody;
00338 
00339 // Called to add data to the post body. Will append to postBody when shouldStreamPostDataFromDisk is false, or write to postBodyWriteStream when true
00340 - (void)appendPostData:(NSData *)data;
00341 - (void)appendPostDataFromFile:(NSString *)file;

00343 #pragma mark get information about this request
00344 
00345 // Returns the contents of the result as an NSString (not appropriate for binary data - used responseData instead)
00346 - (NSString *)responseString;
00347 
00348 // Response data, automatically uncompressed where appropriate
00349 - (NSData *)responseData;
00350 
00351 // Returns true if the response was gzip compressed
00352 - (BOOL)isResponseCompressed;

00354 #pragma mark running a request
00355 
00356 // Run a request asynchronously by adding it to the global queue
00357 // (Use [request start] for a synchronous request)
00358 - (void)startAsynchronous;
00359 
00360 #pragma mark request logic
00361 
00362 // Main request loop is in here
00363 - (void)loadRequest;
00364 
00365 // Start the read stream. Called by loadRequest, and again to restart the request when authentication is needed
00366 - (void)startRequest;
00367 
00368 // Call to delete the temporary file used during a file download (if it exists)
00369 // No need to call this if the request succeeds - it is removed automatically
00370 - (void)removeTemporaryDownloadFile;
00371 
00372 // Call to remove the file used as the request body
00373 // No need to call this if the request succeeds and you didn't specify postBodyFilePath manually - it is removed automatically
00374 - (void)removePostDataFile;

00379 - (ASIHTTPRequest *)HEADRequest;

00386 - (void)updateUploadProgress;
00387 - (void)resetDownloadProgress:(unsigned long long)value;
00388 - (void)updateDownloadProgress;

00390 // Called when authorisation is needed, as we only find out we don't have permission to something when the upload is complete
00391 - (void)removeUploadProgressSoFar;
00392 
00393 // Helper method for interacting with progress indicators to abstract the details of different APIS (NSProgressIndicator and UIProgressView)
00394 + (void)setProgress:(double)progress forProgressIndicator:(id)indicator;

00397 
00398 // Called when a request completes successfully, lets the delegate now via didFinishSelector
00399 - (void)requestFinished;
00400 
00401 // Called when a request fails, and lets the delegate now via didFailSelector
00402 - (void)failWithError:(NSError *)theError;

00404 #pragma mark parsing HTTP response headers
00405 
00406 // Reads the response headers to find the content length, encoding, cookies for the session 
00407 // Also initiates request redirection when shouldRedirect is true
00408 // Returns true if the request needs a username and password (or if those supplied were incorrect)
00409 - (BOOL)readResponseHeadersReturningAuthenticationFailure;

00412

00414 - (BOOL)applyCredentials:(NSDictionary *)newCredentials;
00415 - (BOOL)applyProxyCredentials:(NSDictionary *)newCredentials;
00416 
00417 // Attempt to obtain credentials for this request from the URL, username and password or keychain
00418 - (NSMutableDictionary *)findCredentials;
00419 - (NSMutableDictionary *)findProxyCredentials;
00420 
00421 // Unlock (unpause) the request thread so it can resume the request
00422 // Should be called by delegates when they have populated the authentication information after an authentication challenge
00423 - (void)retryUsingSuppliedCredentials;
00424 
00425 // Should be called by delegates when they wish to cancel authentication and stop
00426 - (void)cancelAuthentication;
00427 
00428 // Apply authentication information and resume the request after an authentication challenge
00429 - (void)attemptToApplyCredentialsAndResume;
00430 - (void)attemptToApplyProxyCredentialsAndResume;
00431 
00432 // Attempt to show the built-in authentication dialog, returns YES if credentials were supplied, NO if user cancelled dialog / dialog is disabled / running on main thread
00433 // Currently only used on iPhone OS
00434 - (BOOL)showProxyAuthenticationDialog;
00435 - (BOOL)showAuthenticationDialog;
00436

00438 // Used when shouldPresentCredentialsBeforeChallenge is YES
00439 - (void)addBasicAuthenticationHeaderWithUsername:(NSString *)theUsername andPassword:(NSString *)thePassword;

00529 #pragma mark bandwidth measurement / throttling
00530 
00531 // The maximum number of bytes ALL requests can send / receive in a second
00532 // This is a rough figure. The actual amount used will be slightly more, this does not include HTTP headers
00533 + (unsigned long)maxBandwidthPerSecond;
00534 + (void)setMaxBandwidthPerSecond:(unsigned long)bytes;
00535 
00536 // Get a rough average (for the last 5 seconds) of how much bandwidth is being used, in bytes
00537 + (unsigned long)averageBandwidthUsedPerSecond;
00538 
00539 // Will return YES is bandwidth throttling is currently in use
00540 + (BOOL)isBandwidthThrottled;
00541 
00542 // Used internally to record bandwidth use, and by ASIInputStreams when uploading. It's probably best if you don't mess with this.
00543 + (void)incrementBandwidthUsedInLastSecond:(unsigned long)bytes;
00544 
00545 // On iPhone, ASIHTTPRequest can automatically turn throttling on and off as the connection type changes between WWAN and WiFi
00546 
00547 #if TARGET_OS_IPHONE
00548 // Set to YES to automatically turn on throttling when WWAN is connected, and automatically turn it off when it isn't
00549 + (void)setShouldThrottleBandwidthForWWAN:(BOOL)throttle;
00550 
00551 // Turns on throttling automatically when WWAN is connected using a custom limit, and turns it off automatically when it isn't
00552 + (void)throttleBandwidthForWWANUsingLimit:(unsigned long)limit;
00553 
00554 // Called when the status of the network changes
00555 + (void)reachabilityChanged:(NSNotification *)note;
00556 #endif
00557 
00558 // Returns the maximum amount of data we can read as part of the current measurement period, and sleeps this thread if our allowance is used up
00559 + (unsigned long)maxUploadReadLength;

00563 // Determines whether we're on iPhone OS 2.0 at runtime, currently used to determine whether we should apply a workaround for an issue with converting longs to doubles on iPhone OS 2
00564 + (BOOL)isiPhoneOS2;

00568 + (NSString *)base64forData:(NSData *)theData;

00570 #pragma mark ===
00571 
00572 @property (retain) NSString *username;
00573 @property (retain) NSString *password;
00574 @property (retain) NSString *domain;
00575 
00576 @property (retain) NSString *proxyUsername;
00577 @property (retain) NSString *proxyPassword;
00578 @property (retain) NSString *proxyDomain;
00579 
00580 @property (retain) NSString *proxyHost;
00581 @property (assign) int proxyPort;
00582 
00583 @property (retain,setter=setURL:) NSURL *url;
00584 @property (assign) id delegate;
00585 @property (assign) id queue;
00586 @property (assign) id uploadProgressDelegate;
00587 @property (assign) id downloadProgressDelegate;
00588 @property (assign) BOOL useKeychainPersistance;
